* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I don't think we should distribute the API of `finRotate` across multiple files, especially as the file `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin` (here renamed to `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Basic`) is quite the grab-bag of random things.

Please move the definition + API of `finRotate` into the new file and call it `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Rotate` rather than `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Lemmas`.

> I don't think we should distribute the API of `finRotate` across multiple files, especially as the file `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin` (here renamed to `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Basic`) is quite the grab-bag of random things.
> 
> Please move the definition + API of `finRotate` into the new file and call it `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Rotate` rather than `Mathlib.Logic.Equiv.Fin.Lemmas`.

That sounds very reasonable - done!

Can this be promoted to an `Iff`? Also, is something like `(finRotate _).symm i < i` similarly true for `i ≠ 0`?
Added a couple of lemmas and changed the theorem to an iff statement.

This lemma is backwards, `val_ne` refers to the RHS not the LHS.

Can you also add the `val_eq_zero_iff` version, and mark both `norm_cast` and the `=` one `simp`?
I think this should be stated with `NeZero n` and `Fin n`
In that case should I also restate `finRotate_succ_apply` ?

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma finRotate_succ_symm_apply [NeZero n] (i : Fin n) : (finRotate _).symm i = i - 1 := by
```

This is a significant change of contract: this line is here because we went to some trouble not to have this file depend on certain parts of the library.

The right fix for triggering an assertion error like this is usually to rearrange your code so that you continue to conform to the contract.

In this case since it is only your proofs (and not statements) that need the new import, you could try to find proofs which do not need the new import but probably the best thing is to move your lemmas. E.g., create a new file with the definition + API for `finRotate`.
Good point - fixed by doing some file splitting.
Please update this after the reorganisation.
Done!

```suggestion
/-! # Maximum order cyclic permutations on `Fin n`
```
